radiographic_examinations.findings: Gallbladder is markedly inflamed, distended and hydropic, measuring up to 17 cm in length x 4.8 x 4.5 cm. Gallbladder wall measures up to 7 mm in diameter. Cholelithiasis with a large stone measuring up to 4.3 cm. Stones are seen within the gallbladder and cystic duct, which is dilated up to 9 mm. Lungs show subsegmental atelectasis. Liver, spleen, pancreas, kidneys, small and large bowel appear normal. No free air, free fluid, or lymphadenopathy is seen.
